explanation: Agent A is correct. The four explicit (void) expression-statements are no-op evaluations: they have no side-effects and removing them does not change the program behaviour. Under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 (“Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code”), such executed no-op statements meet the definition of dead code and therefore violate the rule. (The test harness details and failed compilation are irrelevant to the logical determination: the presence of these (void) casts in the source makes them no-op operations and thus subject to Rule 2.2.)
